rowan.2: The warmth of the sun and smell of summer hay.
rowan.5: I thought we'd end up in one of those slave pits.
rowan.8: Is there anything I can help you with?
rowan.9: Of course. I will do that.
rowan.10: Sorry captain, Riversmouth is not my destination.

rowan.2: I am here to declare my arrival as law demands
rowan.5: I am here to declare my arrival as law demands
rowan.8: I am here to declare my arrival as law demands
rowan.11: I am here to declare my arrival as law demands
rowan.14: I am here to declare my arrival as law demands

captain.1: Not the smoothest of my journeys.
captain.2: Those pirates grow more dangerous every year.
captain.3: And we lost good men. Cargo too.
captain.5: Your belongings are in the chest.
captain.5_1: What's left of them at least.
captain.6: And show you papers to city guards in Cleonel.
captain.8: Not much you can do for the old Edora now,
captain.8_1: but I appreciate you asked. I still have my
captain.8_2: charm. If you ever visit Riversmouth, please
captain.8_3: find Silus. He will know the rest.

city guard.1: (The man at the table doesn't react to you)
city guard.4: Crown needs everyone they can get these days
city guard.6: Well well. A royal seal. So you are a special
city guard.8: I didn't realize you were expecting this man...
city guard.9: Of course, sir. I will store it right away

dunstan.1: What's going on here? Don't you recognize my guest?
dunstan.2: Indeed. Now, go take care of his papers. On the double.
dunstan.4: Yes, a regiment commander. I served the crown long
dunstan.5: enough to get you out of there. Not as fast as I had hoped.
dunstan.7: Let's move to my home. I introduce you to Vyola and kids.
dunstan.7_1: Besides, you must be hungry and in need of rest.
dunstan.8: Let's go. Tell me the whole story on the way.
